title: New Hyundai Verna SX+ trim launched at Rs 13.79 lakh
description: The Hyundai Verna has a new SX+ variant, which is priced at Rs 13.79 lakh for the manual gearbox and Rs 15.04 lakh for the IVT (intelligent variable transmission), both ex-showroom. This new trim borrows many features from the top SX(O) variant, widening Verna's appeal. Hyundai India is also offering a wired-to-wireless adapter for select variants of the midsize sedan, enabling wireless Apple CarPlay and Android Auto. In addition to Verna, Hyundai is also offering the adapter with Grand i10 Nios, Exter, Aura, Venue (also N Line) and Alcazar models. New Hyundai wireless adapter costs Rs 4,500 Verna SX+ trim gets ventilated and heated front seats, Bose speakers Hyundai Verna price Hyundai Verna price (ex-showroom, Delhi)Engine and gearboxPrice (Rs, lakh)1.5L petrol EX11.071.5L petrol S12.371.5L petrol SX13.151.5L petrol S IVT13.621.5L petrol SX+ (new)13.791.5L petrol SX IVT14.401.5L petrol SX(O)14.831.5L turbo petrol SX151.5L petrol SX+ IVT (new)15.041.5L turbo petrol S(O) DCT15.271.5L turbo petrol SX(O)16.161.5L turbo petrol SX DCT16.251.5L petrol SX(O) IVT16.361.5L turbo petrol SX(O) DCT17.55 The new wired-to-wireless adapter is priced at Rs 4,500. It's compatible only with the SX(O), SX Turbo, and SX(O) Turbo variants of the Verna, which come with a 10.25-inch touchscreen. While the base Verna E trim doesn't get a touchscreen at all, the S, SX, SX+ and S(O) Turbo variants with a smaller 8-inch unit already support wireless Apple CarPlay and Android Auto. Hyundai Verna SX+ features The SX+ comes with features like LED headlights, front parking sensors, 16-inch alloy wheels and a rear spoiler. However, it borrows an 8-speaker Bose sound system, heated and ventilated front seats and leatherette seat upholstery from the top-spec SX(O) variant. On the safety front, it gets six airbags (standard across all Hyundai models), ABD with EBD, ESC, TPMS and a rear parking camera. Hyundai Verna SX+ powertrain The Verna SX+ is available only with the 1.5-litre, four-cylinder, naturally aspirated petrol engine. Mated to either a 6-speed manual or 6-speed IVT, the Hyundai engine generates 115hp and 143.8Nm. As per the ARAI cycle, Verna 1.5 MPI IVT is rated at 19.6kpl, while the manual gearbox version is rated at 18.6kpl. html:
The Verna SX+ sits above the SX variant and borrows many features from the top-spec SX(O).

The Hyundai Verna has a new SX+ variant, which is priced at Rs 13.79 lakh for the manual gearbox and Rs 15.04 lakh for the IVT (intelligent variable transmission), both ex-showroom. This new trim borrows many features from the top SX(O) variant, widening Verna's appeal. Hyundai India is also offering a wired-to-wireless adapter for select variants of the midsize sedan, enabling wireless Apple CarPlay and Android Auto. In addition to Verna, Hyundai is also offering the adapter with Grand i10 Nios, Exter, Aura, Venue (also N Line) and Alcazar models.

  1. New Hyundai wireless adapter costs Rs 4,500
  2. Verna SX+ trim gets ventilated and heated front seats, Bose speakers

The new wired-to-wireless adapter is priced at Rs 4,500. It's compatible only with the SX(O), SX Turbo, and SX(O) Turbo variants of the Verna, which come with a 10.25-inch touchscreen. While the base Verna E trim doesn't get a touchscreen at all, the S, SX, SX+ and S(O) Turbo variants with a smaller 8-inch unit already support wireless Apple CarPlay and Android Auto.

Hyundai Verna SX+ features

The SX+ comes with features like LED headlights, front parking sensors, 16-inch alloy wheels and a rear spoiler. However, it borrows an 8-speaker Bose sound system, heated and ventilated front seats and leatherette seat upholstery from the top-spec SX(O) variant. On the safety front, it gets six airbags (standard across all Hyundai models), ABD with EBD, ESC, TPMS and a rear parking camera.

Hyundai Verna SX+ powertrain

The Verna SX+ is available only with the 1.5-litre, four-cylinder, naturally aspirated petrol engine. Mated to either a 6-speed manual or 6-speed IVT, the Hyundai engine generates 115hp and 143.8Nm. As per the ARAI cycle, Verna 1.5 MPI IVT is rated at 19.6kpl, while the manual gearbox version is rated at 18.6kpl.
